headline.main: Broncos, Head Coach Fox Part Ways After Four Years
headline.print_headline: Broncos, Head Coach Fox Part Ways After Four Years

docs.lead_paragraph: The Denver Broncos and head coach John Fox have mutually agreed to part ways, the National Football League team said on Monday, a day after a season-ending playoff loss to the Indianapolis Colts.
docs.snippet: The Denver Broncos and head coach John Fox have mutually agreed to part ways, the National Football League team said on Monday, a day after a season-ending playoff loss to the Indianapolis Colts....

headline.main: Looming Putter Ban a Belly Ache for Some
headline.print_headline: Looming Putter Ban a Belly Ache for Some

docs.lead_paragraph: Less than a year remains before PGA Tour players have to accept a ban by golf's rulemakers on long putters being anchored to the body and Tim Clark is among those who expect "some challenges along the way."

headline.main: Dozens Excused From Jury Pool in Marathon Bombing Trial
headline.print_headline: Dozens Excused From Jury Pool in Marathon Bombing Trial

docs.lead_paragraph: A judge has excused 124 potential jurors in the federal death penalty case against Boston Marathon bombing suspect Dzhokhar Tsarnaev (joh-HAHR' tsahr-NEYE'-ehv).

headline.main: 2 Penn State Trustees Say NCAA Settlement May Be in Works
headline.print_headline: 2 Penn State Trustees Say NCAA Settlement May Be in Works

docs.lead_paragraph: Two Penn State trustees said Monday they have learned the university has proposed new settlement terms with the NCAA in a lawsuit related to the handling of the Jerry Sandusky child molestation scandal and want their board chairman to tell them the details.

headline.main: Making It Rain: Members of Congress Are Mostly Millionaires

docs.abstract: Members of Congress hold a lot of the power in America and, a new report shows, plenty of wealth. In fact, more than half of them are millionaires.
